messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: British  Humor
messages.msgSnippet: Throwez le vache!! Johanna Life is the ultimate learning experience! ... From:  To:  Sent: Monday,
messages.messageBody:
Throwez le vache!!
Johanna
Life is the ultimate learning experience!
----- Original Message -----
From: <KathrynJB@...>
To: <Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Monday, September 10, 2001 2:22 PM
Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: British Humor


> In a message dated 09/10/2001 2:38:01 PM Eastern Daylight Time,
> Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:
>
>
> > Have you introduced her to Monty Python?
> >
>
> Just a warning from One Who Knows. Introducing your child to Monty Python
> means that you will spend much time having long excerpts of MP skits
recited
> to you at length. There will also be much communication in fake British
> accents. These are not necessarily BAD things, but it seemed important in
the
> name of Full Disclosure.
>
> Kathryn
>
> "She turned me into a newt!"
> "A newt?"
> "I got better."
>
>
> [Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
>

messages.msgSnippet: ... But this isn t an argument . . . Oh, no, this is abuse, you want the door to the left. Nudge, Nudge, Know what I mean! Bridget ~~~~If electricity comes
messages.messageBody:
On Mon, 10 Sep 2001 15:22:06 EDT KathrynJB@... writes:

> Just a warning from One Who Knows. Introducing your child to Monty
> Python
> means that you will spend much time having long excerpts of MP skits
> recited
> to you at length.

But this isn't an argument . . .
Oh, no, this is abuse, you want the door to the left.

Nudge, Nudge, Know what I mean!

Bridget


~~~~If electricity comes from electrons...does that mean that morality
comes from morons?~~~~
I sent my Soul through the Invisible,
Some letter of that After-life to spell;
And by and by my Soul returned to me,
And answered, "I Myself am Heaven and Hell." -- The Rubaiyat

messages.subject: Re: British  Humor
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 09/10/2001 2:38:01 PM Eastern Daylight Time, ... Just a warning from One Who Knows. Introducing your child to Monty Python means that you
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 09/10/2001 2:38:01 PM Eastern Daylight Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:


> Have you introduced her to Monty Python?
>

Just a warning from One Who Knows. Introducing your child to Monty Python
means that you will spend much time having long excerpts of MP skits recited
to you at length. There will also be much communication in fake British
accents. These are not necessarily BAD things, but it seemed important in the
name of Full Disclosure.

Kathryn

"She turned me into a newt!"
"A newt?"
"I got better."


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
